The data\'s size is about 150 KB. Offline data Do you enjoy SasaBus? Would you like to rate it? Would you mind giving us feedback? Yes Not really No, thanks Added line %s to favorites Removed line %s from favorites No favorite lines Tap and hold a line to add it to the favorites so you can easily access it later. No hydrogen buses driving There are no hydrogen buses in service at the moment. Added %s to favorites Removed %s from favorites No favorite bus stops Tap and hold a bus stop to add it to the favorites so you can easily access it later. Planned trips Please select a line first! Select bus stop Add line(s) Add bus stop Departure time and date Select line(s) Enter title of event Add another notification None 10 minutes before 30 minutes before 1 hour before Repeat every day Does not repeat Every day Every week Are you sure you want to discard this event? Keep editing Discard Some fields are empty. Please fill them out. No planned trips Add trips to get notified about bus departures and bus delays. Trip deleted Undo What are beacons? Beacons are tiny devices that send data via Bluetooth to any user in range. They are mounted in every bus and nearly at all bus stops. The user can read the beacons\' data. This functionality is used to show the user information about the bus he is driving in or, alternatively, the bus stop he is waiting at. Trip detection Using the beacons attached at buses and bus stops the app is capable of recording and saving your trips when Bluetooth is turned on. In case you shouldn’t know what beacons are, please read the \“What are beacons?\” section in the settings first. How do I use this feature? In order to register your trips, you need to have Bluetooth turned on during the whole journey. Be sure to activate it already before you enter the bus. It’s not necessary to keep the app open while driving, it will record your trips in the background.\nBe aware that both your entrance and exit bus stops need to have a beacon attached to them. Please do not blame us if the recording of a trips has failed, because there are many problems that can occur, a beacon could be damaged or out of service. How does trip recording work? Many bus stops and all buses are laid out with beacons. When you are waiting at a bus stop your phone will receive the beacon data over Bluetooth, thus it knows where you trip starts. Then it will search for bus beacons in order to know what bus you are driving in. As soon as you exit the bus, the first bus stop beacon that is found will be marked as your exit point. Then you will be notified about your trip and some additional details like vehicle information and CO₂ emissions. Restrictions Unfortunately this functionality is only available on Android 4.4 or higher, because beacons require Bluetooth Low Energy to work. This permission is needed to scan for beacons and give you details about a nearby bus or bus stop. If you deny this permission, the beacon scanner will not work. Are you sure you want to deny it? Without the permission to access storage the app is unable to select photos from the gallery. Are you sure you want to deny this permission? Allow Deny What\'s new Don\'t show again Select result amount Cancel Delete this trip? Send report Your email Explain your problem Add screenshot Add photo Describe the problem Send Invalid email Please fill out the whole form Sending report… Real-time data Agreement Permission SasaBus informs you about departures, delays, paths and bus stops of the urban buses in Bolzano and Merano. Enable Bluetooth to get information of nearby buses and bus stops. The app will record and save your trips. By using SasaBus you agree to the %1$s and the %2$s. Terms and Conditions Privacy Policy As of Android 6 the app needs the location permission to scan for beacons. Please grant it. The offline data (about 150 KB) needs to be updated.
